page_analyses.scene: An establishing shot from atop a massive wall, looking down into a densely populated city. A large gate, cannons, and a military-style banner are visible, setting a scene of a fortified city.

character_interactions.interaction: No specific character interactions are visible. Numerous background citizens are seen walking in the streets far below.

page_analyses.scene: Eren and Mikasa are walking through a busy town street. Eren, who was just crying, asks Mikasa to keep it a secret. As they talk, they are approached by an adult acquaintance, Hannes, who notices Eren's tear-stained face.

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Yeager
dialogue_order.text: DON'T TELL ANYONE...

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Yeager
dialogue_order.text: ...THAT I WAS CRYING.

dialogue_order.speaker: Mikasa Ackerman
dialogue_order.text: ...I WON'T.

dialogue_order.speaker: Mikasa Ackerman
dialogue_order.text: CRYING FOR NO REASON...

dialogue_order.speaker: Mikasa Ackerman
dialogue_order.text: WHY DON'T YOU HAVE YOUR DAD EXAMINE YOU?

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Yeager
dialogue_order.text: DON'T BE STUPID! LIKE I CAN TELL MY OLD MAN ABOUT THIS?!

dialogue_order.speaker: Hannes
dialogue_order.text: WHAT ARE YOU CRYING ABOUT, EREN?

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Yeager
dialogue_order.text: M-MR. HANNES!

character_interactions.interaction: Eren is embarrassed about crying and confides in Mikasa, asking her to keep it a secret. Mikasa agrees but shows her concern by suggesting he talk to his father, which Eren angrily rejects. This interaction shows their close, sibling-like bond, with Mikasa being the concerned caretaker.
Hannes, an adult acquaintance, spots Eren looking upset and directly asks him why he was crying. Eren is startled and flustered by his sudden appearance and questioning.

page_analyses.scene: Eren and Mikasa encounter several Garrison soldiers, including Hannes, drinking alcohol while supposedly on duty at a city gate. Hannes teases Eren, who becomes angry and questions their dereliction of duty.

dialogue_order.speaker: Hannes
dialogue_order.text: DID MIKASA GET MAD AT YOU FOR SOMETHING?

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Yeager
dialogue_order.text: HUH?! WHAT MAKES YOU THINK I'M CRYING?!

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Yeager
dialogue_order.text: YOU REEK OF LIQUOR !!

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Yeager
dialogue_order.text: WHAT THE... ?!

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Yeager
dialogue_order.text: DRINKING AGAIN...

dialogue_order.speaker: Hannes
dialogue_order.text: WOULD YOU TWO LIKE TO JOIN IN?

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Yeager
dialogue_order.text: NO... UM... WHAT ABOUT YOUR WORK?

dialogue_order.speaker: Hannes
dialogue_order.text: OH! WE'RE ON GATE DUTY TODAY.

character_interactions.interaction: Hannes casually teases Eren about being upset by Mikasa, showing a familiar but slightly mocking relationship. He then invites Eren to join their drinking, but Eren responds with disapproval and questions his commitment to his job.
Hannes acknowledges Mikasa's presence when inviting both her and Eren to drink. His question to Eren implies he sees Mikasa as someone who often gets Eren into trouble or makes him upset.
Hannes is drinking casually with his fellow soldiers, demonstrating a shared lax attitude towards their responsibilities as guards.

page_analyses.scene: Eren confronts Hannes and other Garrison soldiers about their drinking on duty, questioning their preparedness for an emergency. The soldiers are dismissive, which infuriates Eren.

dialogue_order.speaker: Hannes
dialogue_order.text: WE GET HUNGRY AND THIRSTY, HANGING OUT HERE ALL DAY.

dialogue_order.speaker: Hannes
dialogue_order.text: WHAT'S THE BIG DEAL IF LIQUOR HAPPENS TO BE AMONG THE RATIONS SOMETIMES?

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Yeager
dialogue_order.text: BUT IN AN EMERGENCY, WOULD YOU BE ABLE TO FIGHT DRUNK?!

dialogue_order.speaker: Garrison Soldier (cards)
dialogue_order.text: WHAT KIND OF EMERGENCY?

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Yeager
dialogue_order.text: ...!! I DON'T BELIEVE THIS! IT'S OBVIOUS!

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Yeager
dialogue_order.text: I'M TALKING ABOUT IF THEY BROKE DOWN THE WALL...

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Yeager
dialogue_order.text: ...AND INVADED THE TOWN!!

character_interactions.interaction: Eren confronts Hannes about his dereliction of duty (drinking), showing his intense concern for the town's safety. Hannes is dismissive of Eren's worries, treating him like a child and justifying his actions.
The soldier questions Eren's premise of an "emergency," highlighting the complacent and unprepared attitude of the Garrison which frustrates Eren further.
Mikasa stands silently next to Eren as he confronts the soldiers, observing the situation.

page_analyses.scene: Eren passionately argues with Hannes and other Garrison soldiers about their complacency regarding the Titan threat, citing his father's warnings. Hannes tries to placate him while also showing respect for Dr. Yeager's opinion.

dialogue_order.speaker: Hannes
dialogue_order.text: HAHAHA... THE DOCTOR'S SON HAS SPIRIT!

dialogue_order.speaker: Hannes
dialogue_order.text: HEY, EREN! DON'T SUDDENLY RAISE YOUR VOICE LIKE THAT...

dialogue_order.speaker: Garrison Soldier 2
dialogue_order.text: ...THAT HASN'T HAPPENED IN A HUNDRED YEARS!

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Yeager
dialogue_order.text: BUT I TELL YA...

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Yeager
dialogue_order.text: IF THE BASTARDS BREAK THROUGH THE WALL, WE'LL BE ON TOP OF THE SITUATION.

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Yeager
dialogue_order.text: B-BUT IT'S DANGEROUS TO FEEL AT EASE LIKE THIS!

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Yeager
dialogue_order.text: MY FATHER SAYS SO!!

dialogue_order.speaker: Hannes
dialogue_order.text: WELL... YOU MAY BE RIGHT.

dialogue_order.speaker: Hannes
dialogue_order.text: I'M NOT GONNA SECOND-GUESS DR. YEAGER, THIS TOWN'S BENEFACTOR.

dialogue_order.speaker: Hannes
dialogue_order.text: BUT Y'KNOW...

dialogue_order.speaker: Hannes
dialogue_order.text: WHEN YOU BECOME A SOLDIER, YOU GET YOUR CHANCE TO SEE 'EM, HANGING AROUND OUTSIDE THE WALL WHILE YOU'RE ON WALL DEFENSE DUTY OR WHATEVER...

character_interactions.interaction: Hannes is initially amused by Eren's fiery spirit, patting his head to calm him down. He then thoughtfully concedes that Eren's father, Dr. Yeager, is right, showing respect for his opinion.
Eren argues against the soldiers' complacency, which is met with a smug and dismissive remark from Garrison Soldier 2 about the 100 years of peace.
Eren uses his father's authority and warnings to support his argument that it's dangerous to be complacent.

page_analyses.scene: On a city street, Eren confronts a complacent Garrison soldier about the regiment's lack of preparedness for a Titan attack. Mikasa looks on with concern while Reiner offers a cynical perspective.

dialogue_order.speaker: Garrison Soldier
dialogue_order.text: ...AND I JUST CAN'T PICTURE 'EM EVEN PUTTING A DENT IN THIS 50-METER* FORTRESS.

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren
dialogue_order.text: THEN YOU'RE NOT EVEN PREPARED TO FIGHT 'EM IN THE FIRST PLACE, ARE YOU?!

dialogue_order.speaker: Garrison Soldier
dialogue_order.text: NOPE.

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren
dialogue_order.text: W-WHAT THE HELL?! SO STOP CALLING YOURSELVES A "GARRISON" AND MAKE IT THE "WALL CONSTRUCTION CORPS" INSTEAD!

dialogue_order.speaker: Garrison Soldier
dialogue_order.text: THAT AIN'T A BAD IDEA EITHER!

dialogue_order.speaker: Mikasa
dialogue_order.text: BUT EREN...

dialogue_order.speaker: Reiner
dialogue_order.text: YOU HAVE SOLDIERS ON ACTIVE DUTY WHEN THE SITUATION HAS GONE TO HELL... ON THE OTHER HAND, WHEN THE GUYS AND I ARE MOCKED AS GOOD-FOR-NOTHING SPONGES, THAT TELLS YOU WE'RE ALL LIVIN' IN A TIME OF PEACE, AM I RIGHT?

character_interactions.interaction: Eren angrily confronts the Garrison Soldier for his complacent and dismissive attitude towards his duty and the Titan threat.
Mikasa shows concern for Eren's angry outburst, attempting to get him to calm down.
Reiner interjects in Eren's argument with a cynical observation, suggesting that the soldiers' laziness is a sign of peace, which contrasts with Eren's passionate anger.

page_analyses.scene: Eren and Mikasa are walking through town and overhear Garrison soldiers, including Hannes, speaking dismissively about the Survey Corps. This angers Eren, who loudly compares living inside the walls to being a caged animal, attracting the attention of the soldiers and other passersby.

dialogue_order.speaker: Garrison Soldier 1
dialogue_order.text: IT'S JUST LIKE HANNES SAYS.

dialogue_order.speaker: Garrison Soldier 2
dialogue_order.text: HELL... I CAN'T UNDERSTAND THOSE GUYS IN THE SURVEY CORPS WHO WANNA GO OUTSIDE THE WALL!

dialogue_order.speaker: Garrison Soldier 2
dialogue_order.text: BUT IF THEY WANNA HAVE FUN PLAYING WAR, LET 'EM, I SAY!!

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Jaeger
dialogue_order.text: WE DON'T HAVE TO GO OUTSIDE THE WALL FOR OUR WHOLE LIVES...

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Jaeger
dialogue_order.text: WE CAN EAT, SLEEP AND SURVIVE JUST FINE HERE... BUT...

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Jaeger
dialogue_order.text: ...ISN'T THAT...

dialogue_order.speaker: Eren Jaeger
dialogue_order.text: ...LIKE BEING A CAGED ANIMAL?

dialogue_order.speaker: Garrison Soldier 1
dialogue_order.text: PFFT... WHAT A CRACKPOT...

dialogue_order.speaker: Townsperson
dialogue_order.text: DON'T TELL ME... ...HE WANTS TO JOIN THE SURVEY CORPS?

character_interactions.interaction: Eren overhears the soldiers' cynical remarks about the Survey Corps and reacts with a loud, defiant statement that directly challenges their complacent worldview. The soldiers, in turn, are surprised and mocking of his passion.
Mikasa watches Eren with a concerned expression as he gets worked up over the soldiers' comments, highlighting her protective nature towards him.
Hannes is visibly shocked to hear such a passionate and rebellious statement from the young boy, whom he knows.
